step1.sentence: The young pianist's performance completely blew the audience away.

step2.story: Sarah walked into the science fair expecting average projects. But when she saw a working miniature wind turbine built by a twelve-year-old, it completely blew her away. She stood there speechless, unable to believe a kid had engineered something so sophisticated.

step3.story: Marcus had reviewed hundreds of job applications over his fifteen-year career as a hiring manager, so he thought nothing could surprise him anymore. Then one Monday morning, a candidate named Jina walked into the interview room with a calm confidence that immediately caught his attention. She answered every question with sharp clarity and even proposed a new marketing strategy on the spot using real data she had researched about the company. By the end of the thirty-minute interview, Marcus was leaning back in his chair, genuinely blown away by her preparation and insight. He turned to his colleague and whispered, "We need to hire her before someone else does." It had been years since an applicant had impressed him that deeply.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 바람에 날려 보내다라는 뜻으로, 물리적으로 무언가를 바람으로 날려버리는 것을 의미합니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 실제로는 '압도하다', '깊은 인상을 주다'라는 뜻으로 사용됩니다. 누군가의 능력, 공연, 결과물 등이 기대를 훨씬 뛰어넘어 감탄하게 만들 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 바람(blow)이 무언가를 멀리 날려버리는(away) 물리적 이미지에서 유래했으며, 마치 강한 바람에 휩쓸리듯 압도당하는 감정을 비유적으로 표현한 것입니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 긍정적인 놀라움과 감탄을 강하게 표현하는 구동사입니다. 일상 대화에서 자주 쓰이며, 격식체보다는 캐주얼한 상황에서 더 자연스럽습니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: Her singing blew me away at the concert last night.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 어젯밤 콘서트에서 그녀의 노래에 완전히 압도당했어.
